message.content:
cs.HC, cs.NE, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CY. 

The paper discusses the use of learning companions to improve the training of users in mental imagery based brain-computer interfaces (MI-BCI). This involves the intersection of several sub-fields of computer science, including human-computer interaction (cs.HC), neural engineering (cs.NE), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), machine learning (cs.LG), and cybernetics (cs.CY). The focus on feedback and the design of learning companions suggests a strong emphasis on human-computer interaction, making cs.HC the most likely category. However, the use of machine learning and artificial intelligence in the design of learning companions also suggests the relevance of cs.AI and cs.LG. The focus on neural engineering and cybernetics further supports the relevance of cs.NE and cs.CY.
